title: All Nintendo Switch 2 Physical Games You Can Buy Or Preorder Now
description: It's been just one week since the Switch 2 launched on June 5, yet it's already smashing sales records, and it's easy to see why. The highly anticipated new console offers big upgrades over the original Switch, including the ability to play games at 4K resolution and up to 120fps, a larger screen with HDR and VRR support, redesigned Joy-Con 2 Controllers that can even work as mice, and more. But as exciting as the new hardware is, the real draw is the new games. The Switch 2 already has a stacked lineup of titles, including launch titles like Mario Kart World and Cyberpunk 2077 Ultimate Edition, and big upcoming releases like Donkey Kong Bananza, Pokemon Legends: Z-A, and more. So whether you've already secured your Switch 2, or you're planning to pick one up later, you've got plenty of games to look forward to. To help you see what the new console already has on offer, we've rounded up all the Switch 2 physical games you can buy or preorder right now into the list below. While several are already available, many more are also launching in the coming weeks. We'll also be updating the list with notable new physical releases as they're announced.Note that we're focusing on games with dedicated, physical Switch 2 editions. There are many more games available for the system that aren't on this list, including eShop games, classic Nintendo games on NSO, and original Switch games with digital-only Switch 2 upgrades--not to mention the hundreds of Switch games you can play on Switch 2 via backward compatibility.Continue Reading at GameSpot
excerpt: Here's a look at every physical Switch 2 game available to buy or preorder, from launch titles to upcoming releases.
text: GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links. It's been just one week since the Switch 2 launched on June 5, yet it's already smashing sales records, and it's easy to see why. The highly anticipated new console offers big upgrades over the original Switch, including the ability to play games at 4K resolution and up to 120fps, a larger screen with HDR and VRR support, redesigned Joy-Con 2 Controllers that can even work as mice, and more. But as exciting as the new hardware is, the real draw is the new games. The Switch 2 already has a stacked lineup of titles, including launch titles like Mario Kart World and Cyberpunk 2077 Ultimate Edition, and big upcoming releases like Donkey Kong Bananza, Pokemon Legends: Z-A, and more. So whether you've already secured your Switch 2, or you're planning to pick one up later, you've got plenty of games to look forward to. To help you see what the new console already has on offer, we've rounded up all the Switch 2 physical games you can buy or preorder right now into the list below. While several are already available, many more are also launching in the coming weeks. We'll also be updating the list with notable new physical releases as they're announced.Note that we're focusing on games with dedicated, physical Switch 2 editions. There are many more games available for the system that aren't on this list, including eShop games, classic Nintendo games on NSO, and original Switch games with digital-only Switch 2 upgrades--not to mention the hundreds of Switch games you can play on Switch 2 via backward compatibility.After reading about the games, you should also check out our roundup of first-party Nintendo Switch 2 accessories as well as our story detailing why you can only find third-party Switch 2 products on Amazon.Editor's Note: This article was updated on June 11, 2025. Mario Kart World $80 | Available Now Mario Kart World is the Switch 2's marquee launch game, and chances are if you're picking up the new console, you're also interested in the open-world arcade racing game. You can grab Mario Kart World in a couple ways. The first is as an $80 physical edition that's available at Walmart, Target, GameStop, and Best Buy.The other option is to track down the $500 Switch 2 bundle that includes a digital download code Mario Kart World. This bundle saves you $30 compared to purchasing the physical game for $80 along with the console for $450, which would total $530. If you're planning to get both the console and the game, the bundle is the best option--if you can find it. The bundle has been going in and out of stock online, and while it will be available for a few more months, it will be discontinued in Fall 2025. Keep an eye on Walmart, Target, GameStop, and Best Buy for any restock updates. Check our Switch 2 Preorder Guide for more information.See Switch 2 + Mario Kart World Bundle -- $500WalmartTargetGameStopSee our Mario Kart World preorder guide for more. The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild Switch 2 Edition $70 | Available Now The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild is one of several Switch 1 games getting a bespoke Switch 2 Edition. The Switch 2 Edition includes the core game with enhancements like higher frame rates, improved resolution, and integration with the upcoming Zelda Notes app that lets you scope out the in-game map, make notes, and offers free log-in bonuses that unlock in-game items. The only thing missing from Breath of the Wild Switch 2 Edition is the DLC Expansion Pass, but this is available separately for $20 via the eShop. Physical copies are now available at Walmart, Target, GameStop, and Best Buy.See our Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild and Tears of the Kingdom Switch 2 Editions preorder guide for more. Cyberpunk 2077 Ultimate Edition $70 | Available Now Created by CDProjekt Red, the studio behind the acclaimed The Witcher 3, Cyberpunk 2077 is a sprawling sci-fi RPG set in the techo-metropolis Night City. The Ultimate Edition for Switch 2 includes the original base game that launched on other platforms back in 2020 and the Phantom Liberty expansion all on one cart.It's worth noting that Cyberpunk 2077 is one of the few third-party Switch 2 that comes with all the game data on the cart. Most other third-party Switch 2 launch games will use Game-Key Cards that enable you to download a digital copy to your console. In other words, you can pop this version of your game into your Switch 2 on launch day and start playing immediately with no need to download extra game data.See our Cyberpunk 2077: Ultimate Edition preorder guide for more. Puyo Puyo Tetris 2S $40 | Available Now Puyo Puyo Tetris 2S is a Switch 2-exclsuive version of original Puyo Puyo Tetris 2 the launched on Switch, PlayStation, Xbox, and PC in 2021. This new version has all 40 unique playable characters and game modes of the original version, including online and offline multiplayer modes and a single-player Adventure mode, plus a brand-new 2v2 Puyo Tetris Doubles multiplayer mode and compatibility for the Joy-Con 2's mouse controls.See our Puyo Puyo Tetris 2S preorder guide for more. Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma $70 | Available Now The Switch 2 Edition of fantasy farming-simulation RPG Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma features better visuals than the Switch 1 edition. The full Switch 2 version of the game is included on the cartridge.There is also a $100 Limited Edition that includes a bunch of physical extras and bonus DLC. This version includes a physical Switch 1 copy of the game (which is playable on Switch 2). You can also upgrade to the Switch 2 Edition for $10 via the Switch 2 eShop.Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma - Earth Dancer Edition -- $100 + $10 Switch 2 upgradeAmazonWalmartTargetSee our Rune factory: Guardians of Azuma preorder guide for more. Street Fighter 6: Years 1-2 Fighters Edition $60 | Available Now Street Fighter 6: Years 1-2 Fighters Edition gets you the base game and the Year 1 and Year 2 DLC Character Passes, which adds eight additional characters--including Akuma, M. Bison, Ed, Rashid, Aki, Mai Shiranui, Terry Bogard, and Elena--increasing the game's roster to 26 playable fighters. You'll also get four additional stages and Outfit 1 Colors 3-10 for all 18 original characters, plus 8,400 Drive Tickets, which is one of the in-game currencies.There are also four new Street Fighter 6 Amiibo figures and Amiibo cards available.Street Fighter 6 AmiiboJamie -- $40Luke -- $40Kimberly -- $40See our Street Fighter 6: Years 1-2 Fighters Edition preorder guide for more on the Switch 2 edition. Street Fighter 6's Fighters Edition is also available on PS5, PS4, and Xbox Series X. Yakuza 0 Director's Cut $50 | Available Now Yakuza 0: Director's Cut brings the open-world crime drama to Switch with 26 minutes of exclusive new story scenes and an all-new English voiceover track, as well as the new Red Light Raid co-op mode where up to four players team up online and take on battle challenges.Note that physical copies include a Game-Key Card version of the game, which means you'll first need to download Yakuza 0: Director's Cut before you can play. After that, you can play the game offline as long as the Game-Key Card is in your Switch 2.See our Yakuza 0 Director's Cut preorder guide for more. Split Fiction $50 | Available Now Split Fiction is a co-op game where two players aid each other through fantastical fictional worlds. Like the PS5, Xbox, and PC versions of the game, the Switch 2 version will include a game sharing feature that lets you invite another player to join you online even if they don't own the game.Unlike most of the other games on this list, Split Fiction's "physical" release doesn't come with a cartridge nor a Game-Key Card. Instead, it's just a Switch 2 eShop code in the box. Sid Meier's Civilization VII - Switch 2 Edition $70 | Available Now Sid Meier’s Civilization VII is available in a physical edition for Switch 2, but it comes with digital download codes for the Switch 1 edition and Switch 2 Edition upgrade pack rather than a traditional cartridge or Game-Key Card. Civilization VII - Nintendo Switch 2 Edition is an enhanced version of the Switch version of the game with expanded map sizes, Joy-Con 2 mouse controls, GameChat support, and upgraded visuals. Hogwarts Legacy Standard Edition - Switch 2 Edition $60 | Available Now Hogwarts Legacy on Switch 2 is closer to the PS5 and Xbox versions of the game, with improved graphics and shorter load times than the original Switch version, plus support for the Joy-Con 2 mouse controls. This is a Game-Key Card release, meaning none of the game data is included on the cartridge and must be downloaded before you can play the game. Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3+4 Switch 2 Edition $50 | Releases July 11 Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3+4 includes remastered and revamped versions of the classic Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3 and Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 4. The game is launching on the original Switch, Switch 2, PlayStation, Xbox, and PC on July 11. Physical Switch 2 copies are available at Amazon, Walmart, and Target. There's also a Digital Deluxe Edition that adds a bunch of extra skins, a playable Doom Slayer character, three-day early access to the full game, and more. This version is available on the eShop and other digital storefronts.Finally, there's also the $130 Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3+4 Collector's Edition. This physical collector's edition includes everything in the Digital Deluxe Edition, plus an authentic full-size skate deck from Tony Hawk's skateboard brand, Birdhouse. This version is only available for the original Switch, PS5, and Xbox Series X, but you can buy the Switch Collector's Edition and then upgrade to the Switch 2 Edition.See our Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3+4 preorder guide for more information. Donkey Kong Bananza $70 | Releases July 17 Donkey Kong Bananza is launching exclusively for Nintendo Switch 2 on July 17, making it the first major post-launch day release for the new system. The game is DK's first new 3D game since the Nintendo 64, and sees the lovable gorilla exploring--and smashing through--vast, fully destructible subterranean environments in search of the Golden Bananas stolen by a mysterious group known as VoidCo.See our Donkey Kong Bananza preorder guide for more. Raidou Remastered: The Mystery of the Soulless Army Launch Edition $50 | Releases July 19 Raidou Remastered: The Mystery of the Soulless Army is launching on Switch 2 on July 19. This remastered version of one of the Megami Tensei series' most overlooked spin-offs sports enhanced graphics, a revised combat system, new voice acting, and numerous additions to the game's world, story, and gameplay. The Raidou Remastered: The Mystery of the Soulless Army Launch Edition includes the full game plus the Raidou Glasses DLC preorder bonus if you pre-purchase the game. It's also available for PS5, Xbox, and PC. Super Mario Party Jamboree + Jamboree TV Switch 2 Edition $80 | Releases July 24 Super Mario Party Jamboree is yet another Switch 1 release getting an upgraded Switch 2 Edition. Super Mario Party Jamboree + Jamboree TV Switch 2 Edition will feature upgrades to the visuals and gameplay performance, and includes the Jamboree TV expansion that adds new gameplay modes and mini games that take advantage of the Joy-Con 2’s mouse controls and the optional Nintendo Switch 2 Camera. You'll also be able to use the Switch 2's GameShare feature, meaning you can invite other players to play the game's local multiplayer modes with you, even if they don't own their own copy.Physical preorders for the Switch 2 Edition are available at several major retailers. Those who already have Super Mario Party Jamboree on Nintendo Switch 1 will also be able to digitally upgrade to the Switch 2 version for just $20.See our Super Mario Party Jamboree + Jamboree TV Switch 2 Edition preorder guide for more. No Sleep For Kaname Date - From AI: The Somnium Files $50 | Releases July 25 No Sleep For Kaname Date is the latest game in the AI Somnium series, and like previous entries, it blends visual novel-style story presentation with investigation and puzzle solving gameplay. The game is set in a sci-fi future version of Tokyo and stars the eponymous detective Kaname Date and his AI side-kick Aiba. The duo are able to dive into the dreams and memories of others to aid in their investigations, and this time around, Date is tracking down a famous internet idol who has been abducted by extraterrestrials.The physical edition of No Sleep For Kaname Date is available to preorder for $50, which is the same price as the Switch 1 version. A digital version will also be available via the eShop for $40.See our No Sleep For Kaname Date - From AI: The Somnium Files preorder guide for more. Madden NFL 26 $70 | Releases August 14 Madden NFL 26's Switch 2 version includes the base game, though we're still waiting to learn more about the upcoming football title. However, EA has confirmed preorders include the MUT Cover Athlete Elite Player Item, Franchise Coach Ability Points, and Super Star Legendary XP Boost.Madden NFL 26 standard edition preorders are available at Amazon and Walmart. A Digital Deluxe Edition with bonus in-game content will be available on the Nintendo eShop.See our Madden NFL 26 preorder guide for more. Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar $60 | Releases August 27 Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar is available in multiple versions on Switch and Switch 2. The standard edition includes the base game and is available to preorder for $60 for Switch 2 or $50 for the original Switch. There will also be a $10 Switch 2 version upgrade available for anyone who owns the Switch 1 version. Preorders are available at Amazon, Walmart, and Target.Like other Switch 2 games published by Marvelous, the full game will be included on the game card. There is also a Premium Edition available for both Switch and Switch 2 that includes the base game and selection of bonus content:Original soundtrack115+ page art bookSheep pocket plushCloth posterOuter storage boxYou can preorder Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar Premium Edition for $80 on Switch 2 or $70 on Switch.Preorder Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar Premium Edition -- $80AmazonWalmartTargetSee our Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar preorder guide for more. Daemon X Machina: Titanic Scion $70 | Releases September 5 Daemon X Machina: Titanic Scion is set in a sci-fi world where multiple factions battle for control of the world with power mech suits known as Arsenal. Players will be able to customize their Arsenal and pilot it in offline and online co-op modes. Two editions of Titanic Scion are up for preorder. As a Marvelous-published title, the full game is stored on the card.The standard edition is available to preorder for $70. The $100 Limited Edition comes with the base game, extra Daemon X Machina: Titanic Scion's Limited Edition that comes with the game as well as the following collectibles for only $30 more:Original soundtrack on CDArt bookThree flight tag keychainsThree patchesAcrylic standOversized display box with custom artworkPreorder Daemon X Machina: Titanic Scion Limited Edition -- $100AmazonWalmartTargetSee our Daemon x Machina: Titanic Scion preorder guide for more. Star Wars Outlaws: Gold Edition $60 | Releases September 4 Star Wars Outlaws: Gold Edition includes the full base game plus a selection of extra content. Here's everything included:Star Wars: Outlaws base gameWild Card DLC Story ExpansionA Pirate's Fortune DLC Story Expansions,Jabba's Gambit DLC mission,Hunter's Legacy bundleCartel Ronin cosmetic packThis version of the game originally launched for $110 on PS5, PC, and Xbox back in 2024, meaning Switch 2 owners are getting a nice discount on this expanded edition of the open-world Star Wars game.Like many other Switch 2 games from third-party publishers, Star Wars Outlaws: Gold Edition is Game-Key Card release, so you'll need to download the game to your Switch 2 after you insert the cart into the system. Pokemon Legends: Z-A $70 | Releases October 16 Pokemon Legends: Z-A will launch on the original Switch and Switch 2 on October 16. The game builds upon the unique real-time catching mechanics introduced in Pokemon Legends: Arceus. It's also shifting from the traditional turn-based battles of previous Pokemon games to a new, strategic real-time combat system that focuses more on timing and positioning. Legends: Z-A will take players back to Lumiose City of Pokemon X and Y, but this version will be much larger, offering a full city and natural areas to explore.Preorders for the Pokemon Legends: Z-A physical Switch 2 Edition are available for $70 at Walmart, Best Buy, Target, and GameStop. Like other Nintendo first-party Switch 2 games, the full game data is included on the cartridge. However, if you prefer digital games, you can also preorder the digital version of Pokemon Legends: Z-A at Best Buy.If you don't have the Switch 2 yet, you can also purchase the $60 Switch version then upgrade to the Switch 2 Edition via the $10 upgrade pack.See our Pokemon Legends: Z-A preorder guide for more information. Other stuff you can play on Switch 2While the Switch 2 has plenty of physical games, there are even more releases planned to launch in 2025 that haven't gone up for preorder yet. This includes several digital-only launch games, such as:Nintendo Switch 2 Welcome Tour (Digital Only)Arcade Archives 2: Ridge RacerDeltaruneFast FusionFortniteKunitsu-Gami: Path of the GoddessNobunaga's Ambition: AwakeningSurvival KidsAlong with the new Switch 2 launch games, Nintendo Switch Online + Expansion Pack subscribers can also access a selection of classic GameCube games on launch day, including The Legend of Zelda: Wind Waker and Soulcalibur 2.Of course, you can also play (most of) your previously purchased physical and digital Switch 1 games on Switch 2. Some will even have free upgrades, including Pokemon Scarlet and Violet, The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom, and Super Mario Odyssey, among several others.There are also numerous announced Switch 2 games you can look forward to that are not yet up for preorder, such as Metroid Prime 4: Beyond, Hyrule Warriors: The Imprisoning War, Elden Ring: Tarnished Edition, Final Fantasy VII: Remake Intergrade, and many more. Be sure to check our list of announced Switch 2 games to see them all.Nintendo Switch 2 AccessoriesNintendo Switch 2 Pro Controller -- $84Joy-Con 2 Controllers (2-Pack) -- $94Samsung 256GB microSD Express Card -- $60Switch 2 Camera -- $54Hori Piranha Plant Camera for Switch 2 -- $59Carrying Case & Screen Protector -- $40All-In-One Carrying Case -- $84AC Adapter -- $35Joy-Con 2 (Right, Red Strap) -- $54Joy-Con 2 (Left, Blue Strap) -- $54Joy-Con 2 Charging Grip -- $40Joy-Con 2 Straps (2-Pack) -- $14Joy-Con 2 Racing Wheels (2-Pack) -- $25 Amazon BOGO 50% Off Movie Sale Includes Brand-New 4K Steelbooks & Box Sets Amazon B1G1 50% Off Book Sale - Popular New Novels, Box Sets, And All-Time Greats 8BitDo's Best Controllers Get Switch 2 Support - How To Set Them Up And Why It's A Big Deal + Show More More Gaming, Tech, and Entertainment Deals & Preorders Links (5) The 5,440-Page Complete History Of Middle Earth Box Set Is Only $106 At Amazon Walmart Has 512GB Switch 2 MicroSD Express Card For $65 Nintendo Switch 2 Restocks - Where To Buy The New Console DualSense Edge PS5 Controller Drops To Best-Ever Price For Days Of Play The PS5 Pro Has Received Its First Discount For Days Of Play 2025 Brendan Hesse on Google+ Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
html:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

It's been just one week since the Switch 2 launched on June 5, yet it's already smashing sales records, and it's easy to see why. The highly anticipated new console offers big upgrades over the original Switch, including the ability to play games at 4K resolution and up to 120fps, a larger screen with HDR and VRR support, redesigned Joy-Con 2 Controllers that can even work as mice, and more. But as exciting as the new hardware is, the real draw is the new games. The Switch 2 already has a stacked lineup of titles, including launch titles like Mario Kart World and Cyberpunk 2077 Ultimate Edition, and big upcoming releases like Donkey Kong Bananza, Pokemon Legends: Z-A, and more. So whether you've already secured your Switch 2, or you're planning to pick one up later, you've got plenty of games to look forward to.

To help you see what the new console already has on offer, we've rounded up all the Switch 2 physical games you can buy or preorder right now into the list below. While several are already available, many more are also launching in the coming weeks. We'll also be updating the list with notable new physical releases as they're announced.

Note that we're focusing on games with dedicated, physical Switch 2 editions. There are many more games available for the system that aren't on this list, including eShop games, classic Nintendo games on NSO, and original Switch games with digital-only Switch 2 upgrades--not to mention the hundreds of Switch games you can play on Switch 2 via backward compatibility.

After reading about the games, you should also check out our roundup of first-party Nintendo Switch 2 accessories as well as our story detailing why you can only find third-party Switch 2 products on Amazon.

Editor's Note: This article was updated on June 11, 2025.

Mario Kart World

$80 | Available Now

Mario Kart World is the Switch 2's marquee launch game, and chances are if you're picking up the new console, you're also interested in the open-world arcade racing game. You can grab Mario Kart World in a couple ways. The first is as an $80 physical edition that's available at Walmart, Target, GameStop, and Best Buy.

The other option is to track down the $500 Switch 2 bundle that includes a digital download code Mario Kart World. This bundle saves you $30 compared to purchasing the physical game for $80 along with the console for $450, which would total $530. If you're planning to get both the console and the game, the bundle is the best option--if you can find it. The bundle has been going in and out of stock online, and while it will be available for a few more months, it will be discontinued in Fall 2025. Keep an eye on Walmart, Target, GameStop, and Best Buy for any restock updates. Check our Switch 2 Preorder Guide for more information.

See Switch 2 + Mario Kart World Bundle -- $500

  • Walmart
  • Target
  • GameStop

See our Mario Kart World preorder guide for more.

The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild Switch 2 Edition

$70 | Available Now

The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild is one of several Switch 1 games getting a bespoke Switch 2 Edition. The Switch 2 Edition includes the core game with enhancements like higher frame rates, improved resolution, and integration with the upcoming Zelda Notes app that lets you scope out the in-game map, make notes, and offers free log-in bonuses that unlock in-game items. The only thing missing from Breath of the Wild Switch 2 Edition is the DLC Expansion Pass, but this is available separately for $20 via the eShop. Physical copies are now available at Walmart, Target, GameStop, and Best Buy.

See our Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild and Tears of the Kingdom Switch 2 Editions preorder guide for more.

Cyberpunk 2077 Ultimate Edition

$70 | Available Now

Created by CDProjekt Red, the studio behind the acclaimed The Witcher 3, Cyberpunk 2077 is a sprawling sci-fi RPG set in the techo-metropolis Night City. The Ultimate Edition for Switch 2 includes the original base game that launched on other platforms back in 2020 and the Phantom Liberty expansion all on one cart.

It's worth noting that Cyberpunk 2077 is one of the few third-party Switch 2 that comes with all the game data on the cart. Most other third-party Switch 2 launch games will use Game-Key Cards that enable you to download a digital copy to your console. In other words, you can pop this version of your game into your Switch 2 on launch day and start playing immediately with no need to download extra game data.

See our Cyberpunk 2077: Ultimate Edition preorder guide for more.

Puyo Puyo Tetris 2S

$40 | Available Now

Puyo Puyo Tetris 2S is a Switch 2-exclsuive version of original Puyo Puyo Tetris 2 the launched on Switch, PlayStation, Xbox, and PC in 2021. This new version has all 40 unique playable characters and game modes of the original version, including online and offline multiplayer modes and a single-player Adventure mode, plus a brand-new 2v2 Puyo Tetris Doubles multiplayer mode and compatibility for the Joy-Con 2's mouse controls.

See our Puyo Puyo Tetris 2S preorder guide for more.

Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma

$70 | Available Now

The Switch 2 Edition of fantasy farming-simulation RPG Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma features better visuals than the Switch 1 edition. The full Switch 2 version of the game is included on the cartridge.

There is also a $100 Limited Edition that includes a bunch of physical extras and bonus DLC. This version includes a physical Switch 1 copy of the game (which is playable on Switch 2). You can also upgrade to the Switch 2 Edition for $10 via the Switch 2 eShop.

Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma - Earth Dancer Edition -- $100 + $10 Switch 2 upgrade

  • Amazon
  • Walmart
  • Target

See our Rune factory: Guardians of Azuma preorder guide for more.

Street Fighter 6: Years 1-2 Fighters Edition

$60 | Available Now

Street Fighter 6: Years 1-2 Fighters Edition gets you the base game and the Year 1 and Year 2 DLC Character Passes, which adds eight additional characters--including Akuma, M. Bison, Ed, Rashid, Aki, Mai Shiranui, Terry Bogard, and Elena--increasing the game's roster to 26 playable fighters. You'll also get four additional stages and Outfit 1 Colors 3-10 for all 18 original characters, plus 8,400 Drive Tickets, which is one of the in-game currencies.

There are also four new Street Fighter 6 Amiibo figures and Amiibo cards available.

  • Street Fighter 6 Amiibo
    • Jamie -- $40
    • Luke -- $40
    • Kimberly -- $40

See our Street Fighter 6: Years 1-2 Fighters Edition preorder guide for more on the Switch 2 edition. Street Fighter 6's Fighters Edition is also available on PS5, PS4, and Xbox Series X.

Yakuza 0 Director's Cut

$50 | Available Now

Yakuza 0: Director's Cut brings the open-world crime drama to Switch with 26 minutes of exclusive new story scenes and an all-new English voiceover track, as well as the new Red Light Raid co-op mode where up to four players team up online and take on battle challenges.

Note that physical copies include a Game-Key Card version of the game, which means you'll first need to download Yakuza 0: Director's Cut before you can play. After that, you can play the game offline as long as the Game-Key Card is in your Switch 2.

See our Yakuza 0 Director's Cut preorder guide for more.

Split Fiction

$50 | Available Now

Split Fiction is a co-op game where two players aid each other through fantastical fictional worlds. Like the PS5, Xbox, and PC versions of the game, the Switch 2 version will include a game sharing feature that lets you invite another player to join you online even if they don't own the game.

Unlike most of the other games on this list, Split Fiction's "physical" release doesn't come with a cartridge nor a Game-Key Card. Instead, it's just a Switch 2 eShop code in the box.

Sid Meier's Civilization VII - Switch 2 Edition

$70 | Available Now

Sid Meier’s Civilization VII is available in a physical edition for Switch 2, but it comes with digital download codes for the Switch 1 edition and Switch 2 Edition upgrade pack rather than a traditional cartridge or Game-Key Card. Civilization VII - Nintendo Switch 2 Edition is an enhanced version of the Switch version of the game with expanded map sizes, Joy-Con 2 mouse controls, GameChat support, and upgraded visuals.

Hogwarts Legacy Standard Edition - Switch 2 Edition

$60 | Available Now

Hogwarts Legacy on Switch 2 is closer to the PS5 and Xbox versions of the game, with improved graphics and shorter load times than the original Switch version, plus support for the Joy-Con 2 mouse controls. This is a Game-Key Card release, meaning none of the game data is included on the cartridge and must be downloaded before you can play the game.

Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3+4 Switch 2 Edition

$50 | Releases July 11

Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3+4 includes remastered and revamped versions of the classic Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3 and Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 4. The game is launching on the original Switch, Switch 2, PlayStation, Xbox, and PC on July 11. Physical Switch 2 copies are available at Amazon, Walmart, and Target.

There's also a Digital Deluxe Edition that adds a bunch of extra skins, a playable Doom Slayer character, three-day early access to the full game, and more. This version is available on the eShop and other digital storefronts.

Finally, there's also the $130 Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3+4 Collector's Edition. This physical collector's edition includes everything in the Digital Deluxe Edition, plus an authentic full-size skate deck from Tony Hawk's skateboard brand, Birdhouse. This version is only available for the original Switch, PS5, and Xbox Series X, but you can buy the Switch Collector's Edition and then upgrade to the Switch 2 Edition.

See our Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3+4 preorder guide for more information.

Donkey Kong Bananza

$70 | Releases July 17

Donkey Kong Bananza is launching exclusively for Nintendo Switch 2 on July 17, making it the first major post-launch day release for the new system. The game is DK's first new 3D game since the Nintendo 64, and sees the lovable gorilla exploring--and smashing through--vast, fully destructible subterranean environments in search of the Golden Bananas stolen by a mysterious group known as VoidCo.

See our Donkey Kong Bananza preorder guide for more.

Raidou Remastered: The Mystery of the Soulless Army Launch Edition

$50 | Releases July 19

Raidou Remastered: The Mystery of the Soulless Army is launching on Switch 2 on July 19. This remastered version of one of the Megami Tensei series' most overlooked spin-offs sports enhanced graphics, a revised combat system, new voice acting, and numerous additions to the game's world, story, and gameplay. The Raidou Remastered: The Mystery of the Soulless Army Launch Edition includes the full game plus the Raidou Glasses DLC preorder bonus if you pre-purchase the game. It's also available for PS5, Xbox, and PC.

Super Mario Party Jamboree + Jamboree TV Switch 2 Edition

$80 | Releases July 24

Super Mario Party Jamboree is yet another Switch 1 release getting an upgraded Switch 2 Edition. Super Mario Party Jamboree + Jamboree TV Switch 2 Edition will feature upgrades to the visuals and gameplay performance, and includes the Jamboree TV expansion that adds new gameplay modes and mini games that take advantage of the Joy-Con 2’s mouse controls and the optional Nintendo Switch 2 Camera. You'll also be able to use the Switch 2's GameShare feature, meaning you can invite other players to play the game's local multiplayer modes with you, even if they don't own their own copy.

Physical preorders for the Switch 2 Edition are available at several major retailers. Those who already have Super Mario Party Jamboree on Nintendo Switch 1 will also be able to digitally upgrade to the Switch 2 version for just $20.

See our Super Mario Party Jamboree + Jamboree TV Switch 2 Edition preorder guide for more.

No Sleep For Kaname Date - From AI: The Somnium Files

$50 | Releases July 25

No Sleep For Kaname Date is the latest game in the AI Somnium series, and like previous entries, it blends visual novel-style story presentation with investigation and puzzle solving gameplay. The game is set in a sci-fi future version of Tokyo and stars the eponymous detective Kaname Date and his AI side-kick Aiba. The duo are able to dive into the dreams and memories of others to aid in their investigations, and this time around, Date is tracking down a famous internet idol who has been abducted by extraterrestrials.

The physical edition of No Sleep For Kaname Date is available to preorder for $50, which is the same price as the Switch 1 version. A digital version will also be available via the eShop for $40.

See our No Sleep For Kaname Date - From AI: The Somnium Files preorder guide for more.

Madden NFL 26

$70 | Releases August 14

Madden NFL 26's Switch 2 version includes the base game, though we're still waiting to learn more about the upcoming football title. However, EA has confirmed preorders include the MUT Cover Athlete Elite Player Item, Franchise Coach Ability Points, and Super Star Legendary XP Boost.

Madden NFL 26 standard edition preorders are available at Amazon and Walmart. A Digital Deluxe Edition with bonus in-game content will be available on the Nintendo eShop.

See our Madden NFL 26 preorder guide for more.

Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar

$60 | Releases August 27

Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar is available in multiple versions on Switch and Switch 2. The standard edition includes the base game and is available to preorder for $60 for Switch 2 or $50 for the original Switch. There will also be a $10 Switch 2 version upgrade available for anyone who owns the Switch 1 version. Preorders are available at Amazon, Walmart, and Target.

Like other Switch 2 games published by Marvelous, the full game will be included on the game card. There is also a Premium Edition available for both Switch and Switch 2 that includes the base game and selection of bonus content:

  • Original soundtrack
  • 115+ page art book
  • Sheep pocket plush
  • Cloth poster
  • Outer storage box

You can preorder Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar Premium Edition for $80 on Switch 2 or $70 on Switch.

Preorder Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar Premium Edition -- $80

  • Walmart

See our Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar preorder guide for more.

Daemon X Machina: Titanic Scion

$70 | Releases September 5

Daemon X Machina: Titanic Scion is set in a sci-fi world where multiple factions battle for control of the world with power mech suits known as Arsenal. Players will be able to customize their Arsenal and pilot it in offline and online co-op modes. Two editions of Titanic Scion are up for preorder. As a Marvelous-published title, the full game is stored on the card.

The standard edition is available to preorder for $70. The $100 Limited Edition comes with the base game, extra Daemon X Machina: Titanic Scion's Limited Edition that comes with the game as well as the following collectibles for only $30 more:

  • Original soundtrack on CD
  • Art book
  • Three flight tag keychains
  • Three patches

  • Oversized display box with custom artwork

Preorder Daemon X Machina: Titanic Scion Limited Edition -- $100

Star Wars Outlaws: Gold Edition

$60 | Releases September 4

Star Wars Outlaws: Gold Edition includes the full base game plus a selection of extra content. Here's everything included:

  • Star Wars: Outlaws base game
  • Wild Card DLC Story Expansion
  • A Pirate's Fortune DLC Story Expansions,
  • Jabba's Gambit DLC mission,
  • Hunter's Legacy bundle
  • Cartel Ronin cosmetic pack

This version of the game originally launched for $110 on PS5, PC, and Xbox back in 2024, meaning Switch 2 owners are getting a nice discount on this expanded edition of the open-world Star Wars game.

Like many other Switch 2 games from third-party publishers, Star Wars Outlaws: Gold Edition is Game-Key Card release, so you'll need to download the game to your Switch 2 after you insert the cart into the system.

Pokemon Legends: Z-A

$70 | Releases October 16

Pokemon Legends: Z-A will launch on the original Switch and Switch 2 on October 16. The game builds upon the unique real-time catching mechanics introduced in Pokemon Legends: Arceus. It's also shifting from the traditional turn-based battles of previous Pokemon games to a new, strategic real-time combat system that focuses more on timing and positioning. Legends: Z-A will take players back to Lumiose City of Pokemon X and Y, but this version will be much larger, offering a full city and natural areas to explore.

Preorders for the Pokemon Legends: Z-A physical Switch 2 Edition are available for $70 at Walmart, Best Buy, Target, and GameStop. Like other Nintendo first-party Switch 2 games, the full game data is included on the cartridge. However, if you prefer digital games, you can also preorder the digital version of Pokemon Legends: Z-A at Best Buy.

If you don't have the Switch 2 yet, you can also purchase the $60 Switch version then upgrade to the Switch 2 Edition via the $10 upgrade pack.

See our Pokemon Legends: Z-A preorder guide for more information.

Other stuff you can play on Switch 2

While the Switch 2 has plenty of physical games, there are even more releases planned to launch in 2025 that haven't gone up for preorder yet. This includes several digital-only launch games, such as:

  • Nintendo Switch 2 Welcome Tour (Digital Only)
  • Arcade Archives 2: Ridge Racer
  • Deltarune
  • Fast Fusion
  • Fortnite
  • Kunitsu-Gami: Path of the Goddess
  • Nobunaga's Ambition: Awakening
  • Survival Kids

Along with the new Switch 2 launch games, Nintendo Switch Online + Expansion Pack subscribers can also access a selection of classic GameCube games on launch day, including The Legend of Zelda: Wind Waker and Soulcalibur 2.

Of course, you can also play (most of) your previously purchased physical and digital Switch 1 games on Switch 2. Some will even have free upgrades, including Pokemon Scarlet and Violet, The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom, and Super Mario Odyssey, among several others.

There are also numerous announced Switch 2 games you can look forward to that are not yet up for preorder, such as Metroid Prime 4: Beyond, Hyrule Warriors: The Imprisoning War, Elden Ring: Tarnished Edition, Final Fantasy VII: Remake Intergrade, and many more. Be sure to check our list of announced Switch 2 games to see them all.
